text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
MATERIAL CHANGES
This section describes procedures for Counsel attorneys contacted by Service Governmental Liaison personnel seeking legal advice.

Governmental Liaison Program
) IRC §

) authorizes the Service to disclose federal returns and information to state revenue agencies for use in state tax administration. mission of the Service’s Governmental Liaison program is to facilitate joint tivities and projects with other government agencies to improve compliance with federal, state and local tax laws. This enables the Service and other federal, state and qualifying local agencies to perform their responsibilities more efficiently and effectively. See IRM

, Governmental Liaison tions, et seq. The Office of Governmental Liaison serves as a facilitator and coordinator for joint activities or projects between the Service and federal, and qualifying local government agencies. (

) Governmental Liaison may need legal advice from the Office of Chief on a joint activity or project at either the local or national level. The legal issues involved in the Governmental Liaison program include: a. Appropriate use of government resources b. Information sharing c. Legal and policy issues arising from Governmental Liaison activities (

) If the Service proposes to enter into either a joint activity or project with another governmental entity, Governmental Liaison will generally the agreement in a Memorandum of Understanding, Letter of a contract. The Office of Chief Counsel will review these documents unless local Governmental Liaison (GL) is using a template previously approved the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office. (

) Field Office Governmental Liaison. The Associate Area Counsels, Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) Division, serve as Chief Counsel’s contact points for providing legal advice to field GL for routine matters. In general, there is one SB/SE attorney contact for each state’s GL, and each attorney will establish a working relationship with the Governmental Liaison and Disclosure (GLD) Area Manager. (

) The local GL, in coordination with the GLD Area Manager, determines legal advice is needed on a joint activity or project. If necessary, the GL will notify the local Counsel contact. The local Counsel contact will give advice the GL, provided that the activity or project does not have national or, if advice is not needed from an Associate Chief Counsel or a Division Counsel Headquarters office. (

) Novel or significant issues arising in the Governmental Liaison program require coordination with the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel or Counsel Headquarters office. A Senior Counsel to the Associate Chief (Procedure & Administration) serves as the Counsel Governmental Liaison ordinator for these matters. In addition to coordinating requests for legal sent from local Counsel to Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel quarters offices, the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator serves as primary liaison between the Office of Governmental Liaison and the Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices.

The Associate Area Counsels, Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) Division, serve as Chief Counsel’s principal contact points for providing legal advice to field GL for routine matters. In general, there is one SB/SE attorney contact for each state’s GL, and each attorney will establish a working relationship with the Governmental Liaison and Disclosure (GLD) Area Manager. (

) The local GL, in coordination with the GLD Area Manager, determines when legal advice is needed on a joint activity or project. If necessary, the GL will notify the local Counsel contact. The local Counsel contact will give advice to the GL, provided that the activity or project does not have national or, if advice is not needed from an Associate Chief Counsel or a Division Counsel Headquarters office. (

) Novel or significant issues arising in the Governmental Liaison program require coordination with the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office. A Senior Counsel to the Associate Chief (Procedure & Administration) serves as the Counsel Governmental Liaison ordinator for these matters. ) Novel or significant issues arising in the Governmental Liaison program require coordination with the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office. A Senior Counsel to the Associate Chief Counsel (Procedure & Administration) serves as the Counsel Governmental Liaison Co- ordinator for these matters. In addition to coordinating requests for legal advice sent from local Counsel to Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Head- quarters offices, the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator serves as the primary liaison between the Office of Governmental Liaison and the Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices.

Novel or significant issues arising in the Governmental Liaison program require coordination with the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office. A Senior Counsel to the Associate Chief Counsel (Procedure & Administration) serves as the Counsel Governmental Liaison Co- ordinator for these matters. In addition to coordinating requests for legal sent from local Counsel to Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Head- quarters offices, the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator serves as the primary liaison between the Office of Governmental Liaison and the Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices.
37.1 Sections 6110 and 6103 of Title 26

Note: The position is not responsible for determining substantive legal but instead acts as a catalyst to ensure that policy and legal issues are brought to the attention of, and addressed by, the appropriate Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices. (
) The Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator’s liaison responsibilities include: (cid:
) Coordinating requests for advice between the Office of Governmental Liaison and Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel offices (cid:
) Meeting with external stakeholders (e.g., Federation of Tax as requested (cid:
) Coordinating Governmental Liaison training for and by Counsel (cid:

) Coordinating the Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel ters response on the legal aspects and policy implications of proposed templates provided to Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel by Office of Governmental Liaison (

) Criminal Tax Matters. Agreements entered into between the Service’s Criminal Investigation function and other federal, state or local law agencies must be forwarded to the Office of Division Counsel/Associate Counsel (Criminal Tax) for review and coordination with Office of Associate Chief Counsel (General Legal Services) and the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator in Procedure and Administration. (

) Initial Coordination. If a joint activity or project has national implications, or requires advice from an Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Head- quarters office, the request for legal advice should be forwarded to the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator, through the Technical Services Support Branch (TSS
) for assignment. Requests for advice can be: e-mailed to the “TSS
” mailbox faxed

Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Review. Generally, within ten calendar days of receipt of a request for advice from local Counsel on a Gov
The Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordination Program 37.1.3
page 3
Review the request for any issue on which advice should be provided to local Counsel
Review the request to determine if the response should be coordinated among Associate and Division Counsel offices
Coordinate to determine whether advice will be provided to local Counsel from any other Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office
Notify local Counsel and the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator when advice will be provided and whether the advice will be oral advice or written advice (
) Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Advice. Written advice generally will be submitted to local Counsel within

calendar days of receipt of the assignment. Copies of the written advice will be provided to the affected Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices and the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator. If the request involves a combina- tion of issues, the respective Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office shall coordinate their response with the Counsel Govern- mental Liaison Coordinator. The Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator will provide the consolidated written response to local Counsel, and will provide a copy of the consolidated written response to the respective Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters offices involved. (

) Local Counsel Legal Advice. Any written advice from local Counsel to the GL generally will be provided promptly after receipt of the advice from the Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office (or notifica- tion that advice will not be provided). Copies of any local Counsel advice will be provided promptly to the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator.

generally will be submitted to local Counsel within 45 calendar days of receipt of the assignment. Copies of the written advice will be provided to the affected Associate Chief Counsel and Division Counsel Headquarters offices and the Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator. If the request involves a combina- tion of issues, the respective Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters office shall coordinate their response with the Counsel Govern- mental Liaison Coordinator. The Counsel Governmental Liaison Coordinator will provide the consolidated written response to local Counsel, and will a copy of the consolidated written response to the respective Associate Chief Counsel or Division Counsel Headquarters offices involved.
